title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. When prompted to save the changes, selecting "Yes" will save the changes, selecting "No" will discard the changes, and selecting "Cancel" will do nothing and remain on the Source page. Additionally, the dialog is titled "Error."
OB: When editing XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed. The error message states that the source page is dirty, indicating the need to save the changes.
EB: The software should provide clearer instructions and options to the user regarding saving or discarding changes when switching between the source and layout views in the XML Report Designer editor. The error message should be improved to effectively communicate the issue.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message indicating that the source page is dirty.
